gov.usgs.anss.RRPUtil

Class SeedUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.RRPUtil.SeedUtil

  • public class SeedUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This clas is all static methods for maniupulating julian days, day-of-year, back and forth.

      • doy_from_ymd

        public static int doy_from_ymd(int[] ymd)
        From a year, month, and day of the month calculate the Julian day of year. Parts stolen from K&R's C book.
        Parameters:
        ymd - The year, month day as an array
        Returns:
        The day of the year

      • doy_from_ymd

        public static int doy_from_ymd(int yr,
                               int mon,
                               int day)
        From a year, month, and day of the month calculate the Julian day of year. Parts stolen from K&R's C book.
        Parameters:
        yr - The year
        mon - a three didget Man (first 3 letters of english month
        day - day of the monthe
        Returns:
        The day of the year

      • doy_from_ymd

        public static int doy_from_ymd(int yr,
                               java.lang.String mon,
                               int day)
        From a Unix 3 character month in ascii, a day of month, and year, calculate the Julian day of year. Parts stolen from K&R's C book.
        Parameters:
        yr - The year
        mon - a three didget Man (first 3 letters of english month
        day - day of the monthe
        Returns:
        The day of the year

      • ymd_from_doy

        public static int[] ymd_from_doy(int yr,
                                 int doy)
                          throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        convert a year and day of year to an array in yr,mon,day order
        Parameters:
        yr - The year
        doy - The day of the year
        Returns:
        an array in yr, mon, day
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - ill formed especially doy being too big.

      • sanitizeYear

        public static int sanitizeYear(int yr)
        sanitize year using the rule of 60, two digit ears >=60 = 1900+yr years less than 60 are 2000+yr. If its 4 digits already, just return it.
        Parameters:
        yr - The year to sanitize
        Returns:
        the year sanitized by rule of 60.

      • toJulian

        public static int toJulian(int year,
                           int doy)
        Given a year and day of year, return the true julian day
        Parameters:
        year - The year, this will be run through sanitizeYear()
        doy - The day of the year
        Returns:
        The julian day

        create the julian day from a GregorianCalendar
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the julian day

        Convert a Date to a Julian date.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • toJulian

        public static int toJulian(int year,
                           int month,
                           int day)
        Convert a year, month, and day of month to a julian date
        Parameters:
        year - The year - it will be satitizedYear()
        month - The month
        day - The day of the month.
        Returns:
        the julian day

      • fromJulian

        public static int[] fromJulian(int injulian)
        Converts a Julian day to a calendar date in a ymd array ref : Numerical Recipes in C, 2nd ed., Cambridge University Press 1992
        Parameters:
        injulian - The julian date (a big number!)
        Returns:
        An array of 3 ints representing the year, month and day in that order

      • fileStub

        public static java.lang.String fileStub(int julian)
        for a julian day, create the file stub yyyy_doy
        Parameters:
        julian - day
        Returns:
        a string with yyyy_ddd

      • fileStub

        public static java.lang.String fileStub(int year,
                                        int jday)
        for a year a doy, create the file stub yyyy_doy
        Parameters:
        year - It will be put through rule of 60(sanitizeYear)
        jday - The day of year
        Returns:
        a string with yyyy_ddd
